segment.source: Sets the properties for the Stampinf tool.
segment.target: Sets the properties for the Stampinf tool.

segment.source: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.
segment.target: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.

segment.source: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects
segment.target: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Stampinf.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Stampinf.

segment.source: Set the properties for the project.
segment.target: Set the properties for the project.

segment.source: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment and the Stampinf task.
segment.target: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment and the Stampinf task.

segment.source: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files. If enabled, the value specified for
segment.target: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files. If enabled, the value specified for

segment.source: is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed. For example, "Standard.NT$ARCH$" becomes "Standard.NT".
segment.target: is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed. For example, "Standard.NT$ARCH$" becomes "Standard.NT".

segment.target: string to replace the $ARCH$ variable that is used in INX files. The default value is $(InfArch), a macro that selects the current active configuration in Visual Studio. Possible values include

segment.source: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.
segment.target: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.

segment.source: or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:
segment.target: or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.

segment.source: By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable. To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see
segment.target: By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable. To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.

segment.source: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on. This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file. This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file. The string has the following format:
segment.target: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on. This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file. This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file. The string has the following format:

segment.source: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).
segment.target: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).
